column17: Was the participant aware of the goal?1= YES  0 = NO
column18: Transcribe the written answer of each participant's guess  of the study's goal;
The level in which people obey orders; that's why the experimenter records the way we hold the pen; Another possibility is to study our sense of humour; since the tasks are very ridiculous
To be honest; I don't know what is the purpose of the experiment;
Psychomotoric coordination
The goal is to encourage the active use of some parts of the body for people without hands or arms
The aim is to study our concentration level while using different  parts of the body
Learning how to use a different part of our body to do a task
To assess whether we are able to perform tasks with our mouth; Our ancestors didn't write; so they might have used any other part of the body different from their hands to do things
How people without hands can learn to write; and how difficult is for them
To examine the strategy that people apply to perform a task in a different way than usual; In my case; how to hold a pen moving the head to gain balance

Based on the experiment's instructions; the aim is to know our abilities to perform tasks in a particularly unusual way; It could be related to the way we think or act when doing something that usually is performed differently
The aim is to know how we deal with changes by examining the lines we make with the pen
To check whether some stimuli are funnier when doing tasks with unusual parts of the body; such as writing with the mouth; than when we write with hands

The aim is to evaluate the relationship between the sense of humour and the motor abilities; Another possibility is to evaluate the relationship between obedience (to do some tasks) and the sense of humour
To study how affect; at the motor level and at psychological level; perform tasks in a different way than usual
1)To evaluate how many times I took out the pen of my mouth; 2)To check the direction of my lines in order to know if I'm a positive or a negative person; 3) To see my drawing's precision
The aim could be to know our skills in exceptional circumstances; It could be also the capacity that we have to do something in a specific way despite our instinct
To asses our psychomotor ability while doing activities that we usually don't do with some parts of the body
The aim is to know our skills using parts of the body that we do not usually use
To know skills with parts of the body that are not usually used for these skills
The aim is to assess the ability of doing things with other parts of our body
Coordination skills
The aim is to observe the skills that a person who lacks of hands or mobility in them can use; in order to design an appropriate method for them; the mouth in this case;
The aim is to analyze the accuracy of the lines made with other parts of the body different from our hands to invent a useful instrument for our society
The goal is to study the relationship between the sense of humour and our capacity to use different parts of the body and resources to do things
The aim is to check the ability to write with unusual parts of the body to demonstrate that with practice all of us could be capable
The aim is to analyze our ability to perform tasks that we usually do not do
The aim is to check the capacity we have when holding a pen with the mouth
The aim is to understand how we react when faced with a complex and unusual activity; and how we are progressing over time
The aim is to see how we do a task without paying attention since we are concentrated on holding the pen;
Understanding the development of certain skills in people with disabilities vs people without difficulties
The aim is to see if people can learn how to write with the mouth; then it could be possible to help people that cannot use their hands;
The aim is to study how to do things with different parts of the body; This can put forward a solution to help disabled people
The aim is to find out how far we could go by doing a new task such as writing with our mouth; and thereby we could know how it would be the first time
I guess this experiment has the aim to see if we can adapt ourselves to different situations

The purpose is to make us aware about the things we can do but we do not know; although those things require a greater effort;  The purpose could be to see how our brain responds while doing that kind of tasks;
When you are getting distracted; you forget that you're holding a pen in your mouth
This is a study about our capacity to carry out common actions with unusual parts of the body;
I think you are trying to assess whether we can perform a task correctly (holding a pen as requested) while we do some distracting tasks
The purpose is to study how we use an object with a different part of the body
The purpose of the experiment is to see if some parts of our body can be sharpened to do additional functions;
To study the most successful way to perform tasks using unusual body parts
Perhaps the aim is to see how other people can do the tasks we do in a different way

I think it is related to the way our muscles are relaxed based on the pleasant sensations and emotions that we are feeling; Holding a pen is more difficult in funny situations because our muscles are relaxed
Knowing how we act in situations where we have to do something in a different condition than the usual
The use of parts of our body that we never would use to write
The aim is to discover if we express with our mouth the different emotions that the cartoons can elicit; as it could be in the day to day
To see the relationship between the muscles we use to hold the pen and the reaction of the muscles used to view the vignettes
I guess is to measure our ability to accomplish a task with a different part of the body and if  concentration allows us to react laughing to a cartoons that supposedly are funny

I guess the aim is to assess our motor capacity in some parts of the body that we do not use to perform certain activities like this; We usually write with our hands instead of writing with our mouth; They want to know if we can do it through different tasks without previous practice;
To know whether we lose the pen while laughing and if we are able to use parts of the body to perform certain new functions
To observe the effort made by the muscles involved in holding a pen with the mouth
It could be to see how to use the area of the teeth or lips to make unusual tasks and the effort needed to keep that position for a while
I think the purpose is to know the skill or difficulty that we could have to maintain a proper posture with the pen while we do other easy thing such as underlining letters  or understanding cartoons
This experiment aims to link learning (also cultural learning); memory; and genetic with psychomotor skills; that is; why certain parts of the body are used to write instead of others;
To know if writing with the mouth can be useful for people without arms
The aim is to check if we are paying attention to the pictures or we are thinking about removing the pen from the mouth
Cognitive abilities
The aim is to investigate the psychomotoric coordination of each person
The aim is to know whether we can perform tasks with parts of the body that we do not usually use
They want to investigate how people can learn to use parts of their body for a different function
The aim is to study people's ability to perform some tasks while holding a pen with the mouth
I guess the experiment is about the attention we pay when writing with a pen in the mouth; and therefore our agility;
The aim is to observe if some body parts can be used for different aims than the usual ones
Our capacity to do a couple of things at once; While we have to focus on holding the pen; we have to avoid laughing if we do not want to lose the pen and we need to understand the vignettes;

I think is to measure our concentration capacity and some skills that we do not have developed;  Holding a pen with our teeth without touching it with the lips is not common for us;  Besides this; our mind forgets that we cannot touch the pen with the lips while doing activities that requiere attention
Human body coordination
The aim is to check if being in a funny situation (writing with a pen in the mouth) makes us perceive some things as funnier ( i;e; the  vignettes)
Probably you want to study the relationship between writing and the body parts that would be useful for that; This could be useful for people with disabilities;
The aim is to check if our motor skills are related to the sense of humour
The purpose may be to know the differences between the gestures people can make when they are concentrated; laughing; etc;
The aim is to determine our concentration and coordination
The aim is to make products easier to use by people with disabilities

I think the purpose is to know whether we can have the same concentration looking at the cartoons with and without anything in the mouth; or maybe if we can focus on the cartoons being worried about our saliva

I think the purpose of the experiment is to provide solutions to people who can not use their hands to write or underline letters; To do this; they are working with people who do not need to make an extra effort to perform the task; They want to get a position with the mouth really useful for people with disabilities;
The aim is to check how a task performance can be affected if we do it in the usual way or in a different way
It could be to know our capacity to reuse parts of our body (the lips in this case) to perform tasks that are not usually performed with them;
Knowing if people care more about answering questions than for holding the pen correctly
Maybe it is to check the involuntary response of our facial muscles when something makes us laugh avoiding that we can hold the pen
You want to see how our motor ability varies outside our comfort zone; and also how we react to hilarious stimuli
I believe they want to develop a way in which disabled people can interact in a correct way with objects like a chair and they do not depend so much on someone else

The purpose is to find out the most optimal way to hold a pen with the mouth in order to perform some written activities for people with psychomotor problems; Also; it could be to see what way affects our concentration in other activities
The purpose is to help people with disabilities to perform tasks that they cannot do now
Discovering the best way to hold a device for writing (either a pen or a device designed for that task) without using the hands; This could be useful for the adaptation of disabled people

I guess the purpose of the experiment is to make people understand that there are tasks that disabled people cannot do; For example; cartoon 1 shows the lack of audition;  another cartoon represents people in difficult situations like the fishes; The cartoon with the monkeys I guess is also associated with hearing; I think this experiment evaluates how many people laughs at the misfortunes of others
The aim is to discover motor skills
The aim is to see whether we are able to perform simple tasks with other parts of the body
I guess is to determine the most efficient and alternative methods to write in order to help people who cannot use their hands
I guess the aim is to check how our facial muscles move to perform tasks such as joining points with a pen in the mouth; in order to compare it with people with paralysis or motor difficulties;

I think the purpose is to measure our concentration ability (it can be one purpose but not the only one); because you have to focus on maintaining the correct position of the pen while performing a task; Also; you have to be well concentrated if you do not want to touch the pen with the lips
Our teacher said it was to help people with disabilities
To examine which is the most efficient way to perform simple tasks such as writing or manage a pen if you have some disabilities
Probably it is to see what unusual activities or skills can be developed; since  in some circumstances they may become necessary

I guess is to check the possibility of doing psychological tests to people with some motor disabilities that can not use their hands; Also; another aim is to examine the difficulties we have to learn how to use a body part for other purposes than the usual ones

In my opinion; the purpose of the experiment is to know whether our mouth muscles are related to the brain; and our ability to perform tasks with the mouth; Some people can paint a canvas with a brush in the mouth; Also; it is possible to see how some skills can be developed if we do not have the systems that should perform that  action;
The aim is to see the effort to do simple things; for example underline letters; but with a different part of the body than the usual
I think the purpose is to learn how we can use all our body parts and therefore we will know how disabled people feel; In this case; we will sympathize with people who do not have arms
The aim is to coordinate our mental activity with the act of holding a pen with a different  part of the body
I think is to check if we can laugh with a pen in the mouth
To check our ability to perform an unusual task or a common task in a different way
The experiment focuses on how we use different parts of our body to do adifferent function  than the basic; For example; the mouth is for eating
I think the purpose is to find a way to help disabled people to use better a pen; It is like a writing handbook
The aim is to know the feeling of people with disabilities

I think the purpose is to find out what capacities we have to perform some activities with specific parts of the body and in different ways; This would give us information about our capacity and the patience that we would have in these cases
I think it's to see if our brain reacts in a similar way when doing something with the hands or with the mouth; Also; it is possible to see our concentration capacity
The purpose is to see if we can do common activities with a different part of our body
In my opinion; the purpose of this experiment is to see if we can perform tasks with  parts of the body that usually do not use for that task

I think the purpose of the experiment is to know how useful can be some parts of our body even if we do not use them frequeltly; Another purpose could be to know if holding a pen with the mouth is related to our humour sense
Maybe is to know our skills to perform tasks with an unusual body part
The experiment is to measure the motor skills of some body parts that we use once in a while to perform certain activities

The purpose of the experiment is to measure our ability to do something as easy as joining points; underlining letters; etc; but with a different part of the body than the usual; with our teeth in this case
Examining whether the time you have the pen in the mouth (which is an uncomfortable situation) influences your emotional state; in this case; if the vignettes are funny for you;
I think the purpose of the experiment is to determine the ability of people to write or paint something with a pen in the mouth; in order to help people who cannot use their hands to write
Maybe is to see our difficulties to perform tasks without having the opportunity to perform them according to our needs
You want to see if we can perform common tasks with other parts of the body that are not used for this purpose

In my opinion; the purpose of the experiment is to show that disabled people can perform the same tasks that any other person without disabilities; They are doing a study to check if these people can study in the future despite their difficulties;
The motor ability of a part of our body when it has to do an exercise; and our concentration capacity to do an uncommon task (eg; writing with the mouth)
I believe the purpose is to assess our sense of humor; if we think is funny the sadistic or xenophobic humour of the cartoons

The purpose of the experiment is to find out if people pay the same attention to understand something (cartoons) when they are in an uncomfortable situation (holding a pen with the mouth); Also; they want to check the motor skills of a body part that is not used to doing certain things;
They want to test our resilience by checking if our brain is able of processing/performing motor activities with a different organ
The aim is to study some skills that nowadays we do not have developed
Our capacity to do usual things in an uncommon way

The aim of the experiment is to test our skills in parts of the body that we do not have  developed for some tasks but we can perform with developed parts; For example; a person without hands will do better the task of writing with the mouth; since that skill has been developed by his/her state
The aim is to assess the ability to write
The ability of men and women to do two things at once
The aim is to see how difficult is to write with the mouth; despite disabled people have developed some mouth movements to do it  as good as the people who write with the hand
The purpose is to know our ability  to do tasks with parts of the body that we do not  use
I guess is to know more deeply our skills;  limitations and the development of some parts of our body to know more about disabled people;
Our psychomotor ability; Basically; if we can perform tasks using parts of our body that we do not use; and how our brain reacts to such actions
El objetivo es estudiar la forma en que hacemos una tarea con una parte del cuerpo distinta de la ususal y si eso influye o distorsiona nuestra atenci—n en una tarea secundaria
Something related to our laughter and how it affects the facial muscles
If we can use a part of the body in an unusual way
To check if we can develop the same motor skill in a different part of the body to do a task that is associated to another body part
The purpose is to check our difficulty to perform easy activities that we usually do with our hands but with other part of the body
The aim is that we can empathize with people with motor disabilities;
I think the aim is to see who clean the pen after the tasks
The aim is to study our ability to focus on the questions while we are writing with the mouth
I think they want to see if humans can act even if they are not in a comfortable position; and if there is a correlation on what they do and say; To me; it was simple to do and I did it quickly;

I am sure you are doing the same with primates; they do many things with the mouth; Maybe you want to see if we can use our hands because we have that genetic load or we need more practice holding objects with the mouth; You want to know how much progress or delay we have in this motor ability and how it is affected by the lack of practice;
Our skills to do tasks without using our hands as we usually do
I think the experiment is to study our concentration capacity and abilities
The purpose is to do certain things in an unusual way to see if our concentration is the same or we only pay attention to the pen; that's why they ask if we have understood the vignettes

They want to understand the difficulty of using a part of our body for a purpose that is not common and measure the differences between someone with more ability to do this questionnaire and someone who do not have that skill; Also; the aim is to study the relationship between this ability and our personality;
The purpose is to check our capacity to do easy tasks with unusual partsof our body
Maybe is to see the capacity of women and men to perform more than a task at once; Also; perhaps you want to see the proportion of women and men that can do this task
I don't know
You can communicate with other parts of the body that are unusual
If we focus on holding the pen instead of focusing on doing the tasks correctly
Our capacity to do common things withn unusual parts of the body
